僓字的基本解释

僓
tuǐ
娴雅。
长的样子。

僓
tuí
顺。
简易。
古通“隤”，崩坏。

僓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuí］
［《集韻》徒回切，平灰，定。］
(1)颓败。《庄子·外物》：“於是乎有僓然而道盡。”陆德明释文：“僓，音頽。”王先谦集解：“宣（宣颖）云：'於是乎颓然隳壞，天理盡而生機熄矣。'”一说放任不矜。郭象注：“唯僓然無矜，遺形自得，道乃盡也。”成玄英疏：“僓然，放任不矜之貌。”
(2)见“僓僓”。

僓字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　僓； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页116第14
【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?徒回切，音頹。順也。【莊子·外物篇】僓然而道盡。【註】郭象云：僓然無矜，遺形自得，道乃盡也。　又【說文】嫺也。一曰長貌。　又【廣韻】【集韻】?吐猥切，音腿。又【集韻】戸賄切，音瘣。義?同。

僓字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
僓字的起名意思

暂无。

僓
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuí］
["Jiyun" cut back only, flat gray, fixed. ]
(1) Decay. "Zhuangzi Foreign Objects": "So there is almost nothing but the truth." Lu Deming explained: "The sound is decadent." Wang Xianqian's collection of explanations: "Xuan (Xuanying) Yun:'So it seems to be decayed, and the laws of nature are exhausted Extinguish.'" I said let it go. Guo Xiang's note: "Only the only thing that is unscrupulous, the form is complacent, and the way is the end." Cheng Xuanying said: "Yuanran, let alone the appearance."
(2) See "僓僓".
僓
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　僓; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 116-14
[Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Cut back only, sound dispirited. Shun also. [Zhuangzi·Foreign Objects] The words are all over. [Note] Guo Xiangyun: It's nothing but nothing, and the truth is nothing.　[Said Wen] Xian Ye. One is long-looking.　[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Tumbling and cutting, sounding legs. Also 【Ji Yun】bribery and cut, the sound is stubborn. Righteous? Same.
